page.title: 20General Description
page.content: The area surveyed is basically low lying clay and chalk and is used mainly for arable and mixed farming. Although the character of the area is rural the presence of the huge installations built by the oil refineries that border the banks of the estuary is a reminder of industrial progress.It is unfortunate that the companies cannot solve the area's high unemployment problem. There are two small villages enclosed in the area ;East Halton and North Killingholme.The latter is almost a hamlet,save for the church and postbox. Despite the apparently good { {communications} offered by the opening of the Humber Bridge the village remains comparatively isolated.
